content:
TITLE: Initialize Seafile Client (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Initializes the Seafile client in a specified directory. This command sets up the necessary configuration files for the client to function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir ~/seafile-client
./seaf-cli init -d ~/seafile-client
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Start Seafile Client (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Starts the Seafile client, enabling it to synchronize files with the server. This command initiates the client process in the background.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./seaf-cli start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stop Seafile Client (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Stops the Seafile client, terminating the synchronization process.  This command halts the client process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./seaf-cli stop
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download a Library (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Downloads a specific library from a Seafile server. Requires the library ID, server URL, download directory, username, and optionally, the password.  The library ID can be found by browsing the URL on the server after `/repo/`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
seaf-cli download -l "the id of the library" -s  "the url + port of server" -d "the folder where the library folder will be downloaded" -u "username on server" [-p "password"]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Check Download Status (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Checks the status of ongoing downloads in the Seafile client. Provides information on the name, status, and progress of each download.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
seaf-cli status
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uninstall Seafile Client (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Uninstalls the Seafile client by stopping it and removing the associated data directories. Important note: the `~/.ccnet` directory should not be removed if the Seafile server runs on the same host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/doc/cli-readme.txt#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
seaf-cli stop
rm -rf ~/.seafile-client
rm -rf ~/.ccnet   # note this should not be erased if you run the server on the same host
rm -rf seafile-cli-1.5.3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Python Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Installs the required Python packages for the Seafile test environment. This command uses pip to install dependencies listed in the requirements.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/tests/sync-auto-test/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copy Configuration Templates
DESCRIPTION: Copies the template configuration files to the working configuration files. This creates a `run.sh` and `test.conf` file based on the provided templates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/tests/sync-auto-test/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp run.sh.template run.sh && cp test.conf.template test.conf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Seafile Test
DESCRIPTION: Executes the test script.  Before running, the PYTHONPATH and PATH variables in `run.sh` and the server_url, user, and password in `test.conf` must be configured.  The seahub server needs to be started before this step.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/tests/sync-auto-test/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./run.sh test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding GPL Notices to Program Source Files
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the notices that should be included at the start of each source file when applying the GNU General Public License to a program. It specifies the program's name, copyright details, licensing terms, warranty disclaimer, and information on obtaining a copy of the GPL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/LICENSE.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
<one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Interactive Program Startup Notice (GPL)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides an example of a short notice that an interactive program should display when it starts. It includes the program's name, version, copyright information, a strong warranty disclaimer, and instructions on how to access the licensing details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/LICENSE.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Gnomovision version 69, Copyright (C) year name of author
Gnomovision comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copyright Disclaimer Example (GPL)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a sample copyright disclaimer that an employer or school can sign to disclaim copyright interest in a program.  It includes the name of the organization, the program's name, and the author's name, along with a signature and title.
SOURCE: https://github.com/haiwen/seafile/blob/master/LICENSE.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the program
`Gnomovision' (which makes passes at compilers) written by James Hacker.

<signature of Ty Coon>, 1 April 1989
Ty Coon, President of Vice
```
